chunks.zh: 如何有效打击公共场所吸烟行为？
chunks.en: How to effectively combat smoking in public places?

chunks.zh: 本人有慢性咽炎，且对二手烟深恶痛绝。
chunks.en: I have chronic pharyngitis and hate secondhand smoke.

chunks.zh: 上班地点位于一栋高级商住一体办公楼内，几乎每层楼的厕所和消防通道门前，频繁会有一些老哥单独或扎堆抽烟。
chunks.en: My workplace is located in a high-end commercial and residential integrated office building, and in front of the toilets and fire escape doors on almost every floor, there are often some guys smoking alone or in groups.

chunks.zh: 消防通道密闭不通风，因为每层楼厕所就两三个，免不了会通过消防通道串楼上厕所。
chunks.en: The fire escape is closed and not ventilated. Because there are only two or three toilets on each floor, people inevitably use the fire escape to go to the toilet upstairs.

chunks.zh: 如果说消防通道只是经过，闻两口也就罢了，而厕所才是最恼人的地方。
chunks.en: If it's just passing through the fire escape and smelling it a couple of times, that's fine, but the toilet is the most annoying place.

chunks.zh: 每个坑位门上都贴有“禁止吸烟”标识，但也仅限于此，全靠个人自觉。
chunks.en: Each stall door has a 'No Smoking' sign, but that's it, it all depends on individual awareness.

chunks.zh: 蹲一次坑后，嗓子难受不说，一身的烟味特别恶心。
chunks.en: After squatting in a stall, not only is my throat uncomfortable, but the smell of smoke all over my body is especially disgusting.

chunks.zh: 之前打过市长热线，投诉物业对此无作为，后续物业也打电话来核实，并告诉我会跟相关楼层的所有公司签订协议，让公司自己约束自己的员工，如果再发现此类行为，会直接上报消防部门等。
chunks.en: I called the mayor's hotline before to complain that the property management was doing nothing about it. The property management then called to verify and told me that they would sign agreements with all the companies on the relevant floors, so that the companies themselves would restrain their employees. If such behavior is discovered again, it would be directly reported to the fire department, etc.

chunks.zh: 但是这一系列操作下来，现象仍然没有任何好转，而我也懒得再打市长热线了。
chunks.en: But after all these operations, the situation has not improved at all, and I'm too lazy to call the mayor's hotline again.

chunks.zh: 我不反感抽烟的人，但我极度反感公共场合抽烟的行为。
chunks.en: I don't dislike people who smoke, but I extremely dislike smoking in public places.

chunks.zh: 不知道 V 友们对此有什么办法或者经验，可以分享一下，感谢。
chunks.en: I don't know what methods or experiences V users have in this regard, please share them, thank you.

chunks.zh: @euclidhuang OP 有慢性咽喉炎，对他来说，这是重要。
chunks.en: @euclidhuang OP has chronic pharyngitis, which is important to him.

chunks.zh: 难道他没有资格去做这件事？
chunks.en: Doesn't he have the right to do this?

chunks.zh: run 新加坡, 头上有盖的地方都不能抽烟, 除非有标可以抽, 违反几次会被罚的怀疑人生
chunks.en: Run to Singapore, you can't smoke anywhere with a roof over your head, unless there's a sign saying you can, and you'll be fined so much you'll doubt your life if you violate it a few times.

chunks.zh: 作为不抽烟和对烟极度反感的，和 OP 有同感，我目前的作法是：1.
chunks.en: As a non-smoker and extremely disgusted by smoke, I sympathize with OP. My current approach is: 1.

chunks.zh: 找了家相对不错的公司，同事们比较自觉，虽然极偶尔有人去楼梯间抽烟吧，但是很少了，基本上都是去楼下垃圾桶旁边抽烟。
chunks.en: I found a relatively good company where my colleagues are relatively self-conscious. Although occasionally someone goes to the stairwell to smoke, it's rare. Basically, they all go to the trash can downstairs to smoke.

chunks.zh: 2. 住的地方如果有人在封闭公共区域抽烟，我会直接制止，但是一般会用比较温和的态度，其实只要态度上过得去，邻里之间大家都会相互体谅的。
chunks.en: 2. If someone smokes in a closed public area where I live, I will directly stop them, but I usually use a relatively gentle attitude. In fact, as long as the attitude is acceptable, neighbors will understand each other.

chunks.zh: 3. 商场一般就去那几个，厕所里抽烟管得很厉害，所以基本上没有在厕所抽烟的。
chunks.en: 3. I usually only go to a few shopping malls where smoking in the toilets is strictly controlled, so there is basically no smoking in the toilets.

chunks.zh: 反正一方面在不引起冲突的前提下，尽自己的力量去改变，另一方面能躲开的尽量躲开了。
chunks.en: Anyway, on the one hand, I try my best to change things without causing conflict, and on the other hand, I avoid them as much as possible.

chunks.zh: @euclidhuang 墓和邻居杀猪都不违法，在公共场所抽烟违法。
chunks.en: @euclidhuang Graves and neighbors slaughtering pigs are not illegal, but smoking in public places is illegal.

chunks.zh: @worldhandsomeboy 该。
chunks.en: @worldhandsomeboy Agreed.

chunks.zh: @euclidhuang #3 自省也要讲个基本法。
chunks.en: @euclidhuang #3 Self-reflection also needs a basic law.

chunks.zh: 中性和行为和主观恶意/违法的行为是有区别的希望你遇到邻居噪音扰民之类的事情的时候想到的也是这个
chunks.en: There is a difference between neutral behavior and subjective malice/illegal behavior. I hope you think of this when you encounter neighbors making noise and disturbing the people.

chunks.zh: 国内环境建议随身携带 N95
chunks.en: It is recommended to carry an N95 mask with you in the domestic environment.

chunks.zh: 抽烟的我表示, 我也讨厌公共场所吸烟的, 希望吸烟的都马上没掉😀
chunks.en: As a smoker, I also hate smoking in public places, and I hope all smokers disappear immediately 😀

chunks.zh: 边走边吸烟的人最他妈恶心了，走得慢的我一般就超他前面。
chunks.en: People who smoke while walking are the most disgusting. If they walk slowly, I usually pass them.

chunks.zh: 有些傻逼抽个烟还走得快，恨不得路上所有人都吸一口他的二手烟
chunks.en: Some idiots smoke and walk fast, wishing everyone on the road would take a puff of their secondhand smoke.

chunks.zh: @worldhandsomeboy #46 “一点都不在意”，“恶心要死“。
chunks.en: @worldhandsomeboy #46 'Don't care at all', 'disgusting as hell'.

chunks.zh: 真是典阿。
chunks.en: Really classic.

chunks.zh: 确实除了积极倡导推动公共场所禁烟之外我们做不了什么。
chunks.en: Indeed, there is nothing we can do except actively advocate and promote smoking bans in public places.

chunks.zh: 毕竟道德底线这种东西不是娘胎里带出来的。
chunks.en: After all, moral bottom lines are not something you are born with.

chunks.zh: 只能衷心的祝福您的孩子、怀孕的妻子、孱弱的父母到哪都能遇到人往他们脸色吐二手烟。
chunks.en: I can only sincerely wish that your children, pregnant wife, and frail parents will meet people who blow secondhand smoke in their faces wherever they go.

chunks.zh: 受着哈，乖哈
chunks.en: Bear with it, be good.

chunks.zh: 中国成年男性吸烟比例高达 50%，对随处吸烟惩罚力度极低的，厕所消防楼道都是重灾区，春节假期在小城市的餐馆吃饭，每一间都有人在吞云吐雾。
chunks.en: The smoking rate among adult men in China is as high as 50%, and the penalties for smoking everywhere are extremely low. Toilets and fire escape corridors are the hardest hit areas. During the Spring Festival holiday, when eating in restaurants in small cities, there were people smoking in every room.

chunks.zh: @euclidhuang 估计你就是 op 说的那些抽烟的人
chunks.en: @euclidhuang I guess you are one of those smokers mentioned by OP

chunks.zh: @bubble21 认真讲，N95 过滤不了烟味。
chunks.en: @bubble21 Seriously, N95 can't filter out the smell of smoke.

chunks.zh: 应该没解吧，我生平最恨在路上吸烟的人，他在前面吸，我在后面吸二手烟。
chunks.en: There's probably no solution. I hate people who smoke on the road the most, and when they smoke in front, I inhale secondhand smoke behind.

chunks.zh: 但上下班通勤时免不了要步行，如果提前发现，我都会屏住呼吸快步跑过去。
chunks.en: However, I inevitably have to walk to and from work. If I see someone smoking in front of me, I hold my breath and run past quickly.

chunks.zh: 最近半年自己开车上班，步行少了，情况好了很多/狗头
chunks.en: I've been driving to work for the past six months, and I walk less, so the situation is much better /doge

chunks.zh: 日本，禁烟的公共场所吸烟最高 50w 日元罚款。
chunks.en: In Japan, smoking in non-smoking public places is punishable by a maximum fine of 500,000 yen.

chunks.zh: 边走大马路上边吸烟一次几千日元罚款，边骑车边吸烟罚款，乱扔烟嘴罚款
chunks.en: Smoking while walking on the street costs several thousand yen in fines, smoking while riding a bicycle costs a fine, and littering cigarette butts costs a fine.

chunks.zh: 其实国内如果什么时候把抓吸烟罚款这事看成一种创收手段的话，什么时候就能实现公共区域彻底禁烟了（但想想领导很多也抽烟。。。）
chunks.en: In fact, if China ever sees catching smokers and fining them as a way to generate revenue, then it will be able to completely ban smoking in public areas (but thinking about it, many leaders also smoke...)

chunks.zh: 这东西最大的问题就是难取证。
chunks.en: The biggest problem with this is the difficulty of obtaining evidence.

chunks.zh: 在杭州，之前打过 12345 ，那边工作人员让我把抽烟的控制住 。
chunks.en: In Hangzhou, I called 12345 before, and the staff there asked me to control the smokers.

chunks.zh: 真是惊呆
chunks.en: I was really stunned.

chunks.zh: @RoyRao #36  烟草税抽一小部分来设置吸烟区很合理；有吸烟区，但是还在公共场合抽烟，那就罚款创造税收。
chunks.en: @RoyRao #36 It is reasonable to take a small portion of the tobacco tax to set up smoking areas; if there are smoking areas, but people still smoke in public places, then fines should be imposed to generate tax revenue.

chunks.zh: @iyaozhen 北京也就举报管一阵儿，风刮过去了该怎样抽还是怎么抽，男厕绝对是重灾区。
chunks.en: @iyaozhen In Beijing, reporting only works for a while. Once the issue blows over, people smoke however they want, and the men's toilet is definitely the hardest hit area.

chunks.zh: 在天花板粘一个用电池的烟雾报警器，效果奇好。
chunks.en: Stick a battery-powered smoke detector on the ceiling, it works wonders.

chunks.zh: 我也很讨厌抽烟的，自从媳妇怀孕后，更加讨厌，最讨厌边走边抽烟的，一条路都是烟味，每次都得小跑到他前面去；饭店里吞云吐雾的也是，节假日那么多小孩子在吃饭，二手烟吸到饱。
chunks.en: I also hate smoking, especially since my wife got pregnant. I hate those who smoke while walking even more; the whole road smells of smoke, and I have to trot ahead of them every time. The people who are smoking in the restaurants too, so many children are eating during the holidays, inhaling secondhand smoke to the fullest.
